definition: to give a discount/to be of less value than anticipated
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: There's a discount for these sample copies.
Normally we do not give any discounts, because the prices have already been greatly reduced.
sentences.chinese: 通常我们是不打折扣的，因为价钱已经减得很低。

sentences.english: If you're only going to order fifty, it will have to be without a discount.
sentences.chinese: 如果您只订五十台，就没办法打折扣。
汽车制造商打折扣卖掉定价过高的汽车。

sentences.english: USD a night at some 3 star hotels of far lesser quality.
sentences.chinese: 高达180美元一晚的房费但质量却大打折扣。

sentences.english: Normally we do not give any discounts, for the prices have already been greatly reduced.
sentences.chinese: 通常我们是不打折扣摁为价钱已经减得很低。

sentences.english: Wal-Mart is becoming more aggressive on discounting.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔玛打折扣更积极了。

sentences.english: Doctors compete vigorously to win business using steep discounts.
sentences.chinese: 这类医生也会大打折扣来拉生意。

sentences.english: Spend time shopping at discount grocery stores.
sentences.chinese: 多花时间在打折扣的食品店购物。

sentences.english: You should give us discount for such large quantity.
sentences.chinese: 这么大的数量，你们应该给我们打折扣。

sentences.english: Coal power linkage system, in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 煤电联动机制大打折扣，陷入两难境地。

sentences.english: A disorganized cubicle can reflect poorly on the employee’s level of professionalism.
sentences.chinese: 杂乱无章的隔间会让员工的专业程度大打折扣。

definition: the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
a tiny bit/very little/next to nothing (idiom)
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
